data.title: Hospitality Plus!
data.text:
My wife and I stopped by this Saturday night, after a long day of riding from Maryland. We were dressed in typical Harley touring gear. Black leather, boots, etc. We were greeted warmly, and seated quickly, despite being what we would have considered being severely under dressed for the establishment. Bravo for that!!

Our server was friendly, fun, and patient as we thoroughly surveyed the great wine options. Her demeanor just continued the positive experience for us throughout our visit.

My wife ordered the filet, to be cooked a perfect medium rare. She asked for the Bearnaise and Cabernet reduction sauces on the side. She was then told about their secret sauce, which is a delicious combination of the two. So, she brought all three for my wife to experience. 

I ordered one of their specials - two filet medallions, med-rare, with scallops and a Roma tomato Hollandaise sauce over their garlic mashed potatoes. I asked if they would mind substituting out the potatoes for something else. It was no issue at all.

Everything was cooked to absolute perfection! The red wine was presented at the proper temperature (which is NOT room temp); a rarity these days.

After dinner, we enjoyed their flourless dark chocolate torte, with cordials. We would have preferred A nice LBV or Tawny Port, but they were temporarily out. Unfortunate, but it happens. The one Ruby Port they had was up on the shelf... empty. 

We would most definitely recommend giving them a try if you're in the area. I know we will!!

data.title: Great Steaks
data.text: Love, love love this restaurant. Steaks are fantastic along with many other things on the menu. Grilled Caesar salad is awesome. Nothing else to say.

data.title: Low Key Upscale
data.text:
This restaurant specializes in steak.  There are a few other seafood and vegetarian entrees available.  Make a reservation if you are coming for dinner on a weekend.
Pro:  Upscale without being overly fussy.  The food is fresh and well prepared.  Daily specials are available and a good choice. Wait staff is attentive and the kitchen is efficient.  There are party rooms available for groups. Wine selection is good.
Con:  Parking is on the street and often difficult to find close to the restaurant. (bring quarters if you are arriving before 6 pm.)  A little pricy for Greensboro, but quality was there.

data.title: Upscale restaurant with an enticing half-price draw
data.text: We were enticed by the restaurant's half-price entrée promotion on Fridays and Saturdays (!).  For $38, my wife and I shared Chateaubriand for two, cooked medium the way I like it, with two sides and two sauces.  The steak was done perfectly, very tasty, tender, delicious.  Braised mushrooms and brussel sprouts roasted with onions and bacon augmented the taste.  We started out with salads (innovative Caesar:  broiled romaine with a drizzle of dressing.  Needed to be more ample) and split a flourless chocolate torte for dessert (perfect size for splitting).  Our meal before tip was around $75, and included a very good ginger-infused amber ale.  Our waitperson, Paige, was charming and helpful, although she did not read us the specials (which sounded delicious as we heard them at the next table).  For an upscale meal that you can dress fairly casually to enjoy, this half-price entrée can't be beat.

data.title: Not on My List
data.text:
Greensboro has many upscale restaurants, and B. Christopher's could be in that category...but it's not.  Although the interior is lovely and almost intimate, the food is not up to the prices charged.  Almost everything is individually priced, and if you want bread, you need to ask, which our server did not.  Steak was of medium quality, soup was of average taste, and the spinach salad was yellow.  Yes, yellow, as in leaves that were too old!  Not good. 

Wine list is adequate but not spectacular.  Food selections are limited, but perhaps that is all the kitchen can handle in such a small area. 

As parking is difficult in downtown Greensboro, it would be helpful if the reservation desk could make suggestions for clientele. 

All in all, not a place I would recommend unless you are staying in the downtown area.

data.title: 50th Wedding AnniversaryCelebration
data.text: Attended the 50th Wedding Anniversary dinner for my Sister and Brother-in-law at B Christophers.  Excellent Service and Excellent Food.  Our party of 18 had a wonderful experience.  Brant and Brent, our servers, were personable and fun and made this experience seamless. This was my first time at this restaurant.   I will admit that we compared it to other restaurants in Greensboro with a similar price point.  I would definitely go again. Do not miss the desserts.  They are worth a trip just for dessert alone.

data.title: Melt in your mouth
data.text: We were in town for High Point Furniture Market and had a rather large group. The wait staff was amazing! They took time to explain specials and go over the wine list. I had the filet and it was cooked to perfection. It's a little pricey but definitely worth it, you will not be disappointed

data.title: Best Steak and Creme Brulee ever!!!
data.text: The atmosphere, food and service here are all exceptional.  It was a relaxing and enjoyable dinner experience.  We will definitely go here any time we are in Greensboro.

data.title: Amazing specials
data.text: My team and I were in town for High Point Market and we ate here. I ordered the halibut special and it was to die for! The fish was so flavorful and served on top of wilted spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. My work friends had the steak special and also said it was great. The service was a little slow but it was busy that night with all of us out of towners. Parking was a little hard. You have to find street parking.

data.title: good steakhouse, good service
data.text: Had dinner here a short time ago.  Expectations for an old-school kind of steakhouse were met... no surprises on the menu.  The oysters on the half shell were from off the coast of North Carolina, and were great.  The new york strip I ordered was well-executed.  No complaints about the food or service.

data.title: Amazing Greensboro Steakhouse
data.text: Great service and great food. Specials are incredible. Had tuna special for dinner topped with fried shrimp. Both tuna and shrimp were perfectly cooked. Nice atmosphere and stellar service. Must go for Greensboro restaurants.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: service and food were both awesome we are sure to come back! french onion soup was so good and salad entrees were also very good can't wait to come back and try more food!

data.title: Great food and service, if a bit on the pricey side
data.text: B. Christopher's is primarily a steak place, similar in many ways to Ruth's Chris--in quality, price, service.  But they also have very good seafood and a few other dishes.  This is a wonderful place for special occasions, for entertaining "big time" clients and other business contacts, and the like.  It can be crowded and on the noisy side; if you have a group, request a small room!

data.title: Best steak in North Carolina
data.text:
B. Christopher's is like an old school steak house in New York City. It starts with the quality of the food. The steak is hand-picked by Chris, and he only picks the finest meats. I typically order my steak Pittsburgh style and you can really taste the quality. His veggies and sides are always unique and very tasty. 

The staff is excellent. Sarah at the front is great at making sure you get what you want. Ken, Brett, and Anjel are terrific servers: make sure you request on of them.

Chris, the owner, knows how to treat customers the way they want to be made to feel. He's a true pro and a peerless chef. 

I have eaten here by myself, on dates, on special occasions, and for business and every time CHRIS knocks it out of the park. 

Last but not least, Alex, the bartender, is an incredible mixologist and great conversationalist. He works Monday's, Wednesday's, and Friday's. Make sure you request his take on any classic mixed drink. You won't be sorry.

If you're in Greensboro, then you need to go to B. Christopher's and experience what a meal should feel and taste like.

data.title: Downtown Gem!
data.text: Enjoyed a romantic dinner in this sweet spot.  Our service was excellent! Chris came by and welcomed us after we were seated. Drinks were great, steaks spot on and all the sides we had we excellent!  We loved the atmosphere of casual elegance and We are planning to go back again soon!

data.title: Outstanding!
data.text: Have been to "new location" several times & was patron at Burlington location! Service is always top notch! Food is excellent, well prepared & just delicious!! A Keeper!!

data.title: Unfortunate that the only non-chain steak house is so poorly managed
data.text:
My wife was out of town so I ate at the bar. Bartender was very friendly, but  my drink of choice, bourbon, has a very poor selection. None of the premium's I like were available.
Ordered raw oysters, and they were served at room temperature, not on ice. Both the mignonette and the cocktail sauce were poor. Mignonette was devoid of shallots and the cocktail sauce was too thick. 
The steak was ok, but they did not have creamed spinach as a side. First steak house I have ever been in that did not.  
Only reason this is not one star is the bartender, who explained his boss would not give him the budget for better liquors

data.title: Awesome meat and great bartender
data.text: I went to you place late on a Friday night around 930 as they were closing at 10 PM which I thought was a little early given it's a weekend but anyway there was not a lot of people left in the restaurant only may be about 15 but the crowd was nice I ate at the bar I had filet mignon and brussels sprouts that were over-the-top good. I would highly recommend this to anyone whether it's solo business lunch with friends they have an awesome menu

data.title: Your next event MUST be at B. Christopher's!
data.text: I planned a surprise 50th birthday party for my boyfriend on Aug 29th. The entire staff was very helpful in planning and setting the stage for this very special event. I am truly at a loss for words to describe the fabulous food and spirits provided!  The Beef Tenderloin, Three Cheese Ravioli, Thai Chicken Curry, and Shrimp Cocktail were fantastic. My guests loved it! Their glasses were never empty. The staff was attentive and professional. Thank you, thank you Chef/Owner Chris for making the event unforgettable!!

data.title: Delectable Dinner & Putting a Fork in the Greenway Construction!!
data.text:
Not only did we help GSO in funding the completion of it's downtown Greenway, 
we also enjoyed a truly superb meal here. The service was impeccable and we will definitely be back.
Our Greenway Special consisted of slowly braised beef tenderloin lovingly placed upon a pillow of  horseradish infused mashed potatoes with a small serving of perfectly cooked asparagus, followed by a peach cobbler with vanilla ice cream. Although this was a tasting dinner special with 25% going to GSO, it was so fulfilling and the perfect amount of food for us. We plan to try one of their salads or appetizers next time.
